Class OrdersManager

java.lang.Object
OrdersManager
public class OrdersManager extends Object

OrdersManager

Manage orders. Must be used for any operations on an order.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OrdersManager()
    Create a new order manager with empty lists.
    OrdersManager(Boolean load)
    Create a new order manager that knows all the orders in the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • OrdersManager

      public OrdersManager()
      Create a new order manager with empty lists. Can be used for saving a new order.

    • OrdersManager

      public OrdersManager(Boolean load)
      Create a new order manager that knows all the orders in the database. Can be used for displaying an existing order or modify it.

  • Method Details

    • addOrder

      public void addOrder(Order order)
      Send a new order to Santa. The order is saved in the database in the right repo with OrderState 'ONGOING'.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to be sent

    • setValid

      public void setValid(Order order)
      Validate an order. The order is saved in the database in the right repo with OrderState 'VALIDATED'.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to be validated

    • setPrepared

      public void setPrepared(Order order)
      . The order is saved in the database in the right repo with OrderState 'PREPARED'.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to be set as ready

    • getReceivedOrders

      public ArrayList<Order> getReceivedOrders()
      Returns:
      the list of received but not validated orders

    • getPreparedOrders

      public ArrayList<Order> getPreparedOrders()
      Returns:
      the list of validated orders

    • getValidOrders

      public ArrayList<Order> getValidOrders()
      Returns:
      the list of orders that are ready for delivery

    • cancelOrder

      public void cancelOrder(Order order)
      Cancel an Order from Ongoing order repo. The order is completely removed from database.

    • removeToy

      public void removeToy(Order order, Toy toy)
      Remove a Toy from an Order.
